misconfigurations.scenario: AWS Security Hub is not enabled to aggregate security findings
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Security Hub is not enabled and no centralized security posture management exists
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Enable AWS Security Hub to aggregate findings from GuardDuty, Inspector, Macie, and third-party security tools into a unified dashboard
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: AWS Security Hub aggregates security findings from multiple AWS services and third-party tools, providing a comprehensive view of your security posture. Without Security Hub, security teams must manually check multiple services, leading to missed vulnerabilities and delayed incident response. Security Hub includes automated compliance checks against standards like CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark, PCI-DSS, and AWS Best Practices.
misconfigurations.notes: Enhanced at re:Inforce 2025 with improved threat signal analysis

misconfigurations.scenario: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) templates are not scanned for security vulnerabilities before deployment
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: CloudFormation, Terraform, or CDK templates not scanned and CI/CD pipeline lacks IaC security scanning
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Enable Amazon Inspector Code Security in CI/CD pipelines to scan IaC templates, application code (SAST), and dependencies (SCA) before production deployment
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Amazon Inspector Code Security (GA at re:Inforce 2025) provides shift left security by scanning Infrastructure as Code templates, application source code (SAST), and open-source dependencies (SCA). This identifies misconfigurations, vulnerabilities, and security issues before they reach production. Inspector integrates with CodePipeline, GitHub Actions, and GitLab CI to automatically scan pull requests.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS re:Inforce 2025: Amazon Inspector Code Security now Generally Available

misconfigurations.scenario: AWS Config is not enabled to track resource configuration changes and compliance
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: AWS Config is disabled with no configuration history tracking and compliance violations going undetected
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Enable AWS Config with managed rules for CIS AWS Foundations Benchmark and organizational security policies
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: AWS Config continuously monitors and records AWS resource configurations, enabling compliance auditing, security analysis, and change tracking. Without Config, unauthorized changes go unnoticed and compliance violations remain undetected. Config integrates with Security Hub to provide compliance status against multiple standards and can automatically remediate non-compliant resources using Systems Manager.
misconfigurations.notes: Config integrates with Security Hub for compliance reporting and Systems Manager for auto-remediation

metadata.source: AWS Security Best Practices 2025 / Community Contribution

misconfigurations.scenario: users wants to automatically manage data storage tiers
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: s3 lifecycle manager is turned off; intelligent tiering is not enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: turn on lifecycle manager

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to be made aware of the locations of all public s3 buckets (or their contents)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: bucket or its subfolders are open to the public
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- Randomise your bucket names! There is no need to use company-backup.s3.amazonaws.com.
- Set appropriate permissions and audit regularly.  
- If possible create two buckets - one for your public assets and another for private data.
- Try Amazon Macie - it can automatically classify and secure sensitive data.

misconfigurations.scenario: streaming service needs to reduce latency for its users
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cdn

misconfigurations.scenario: No CloudWatch anomaly detection configured to identify unexpected cost increases
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: AWS accounts lack CloudWatch anomaly detection alarms for billing metrics and service-specific cost anomalies
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Enable AWS Cost Anomaly Detection with ML-powered alerts, configure CloudWatch billing alarms, and integrate with SNS for proactive cost monitoring
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: AWS Cost Anomaly Detection uses machine learning to identify unusual spending patterns and alert teams before bills become excessive. Configure detection for services, accounts, and cost categories with custom thresholds. Set up CloudWatch billing alarms for absolute spend thresholds. Integrate with SNS/Slack for real-time notifications. Early detection prevents runaway costs from misconfigurations (e.g., unintended data transfers, EC2 instances in wrong regions, misconfigured Auto Scaling). Organizations report catching 85-95% of cost anomalies within 24 hours.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS Well-Architected Framework - Proactive cost monitoring prevents bill shock

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025

misconfigurations.scenario: user does not want s3 bucket to allow all actions from all principals
user does not want s3 bucket to allow delete actions from all principals
user wants to know WHEN the right time to purchase a savings plan in
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: predictable usage data can be used to justify a savings plan recommendation
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Savings Plans are a flexible pricing model that offer low prices on EC2, Fargate and Lambda usage, in exchange for a commitment to a consistent amount of usage (measured in $/hour) for a 1 or 3 year term. Savings Plans provide you the flexibility to use the compute option that best suits your needs and automatically save money, all without having to perform exchanges or modifications. When you sign up for a Savings Plan, you will be charged the discounted Savings Plans price for your usage up to your commitment.

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to ensure no security gorups allow ingress from 0.0.0.0/0
user does not want rdp ports publically accessible
user does not want ssh ports publically accessible
user does not want instances with unencrypted ports
user does not want networkloadbalancer with unencrypted ports
language used is not ideal for the specific workload
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: change language from X to Y

misconfigurations.scenario: dynamo table read and write capacity is too low
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: lambda fails when trying to read dynamo taber; provisionedThroughputErrorException in logs' consumed read capacity is high, provisioned read capacity units are low
misconfigurations.notes: how do we determine what value to set as the read/write parameter? might be done automatically

misconfigurations.scenario: provisioned aurora db or serverless v1
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: determines, based on predictabilty of the workloads, which db type should be used

misconfigurations.scenario: logs full & cpu utilization spiked
dynamoDB hot shards
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: implement kafka (or other) tool upstream to properly partition data prior to serving dynamodb
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: improper partitioning of dynamodb keys leading to excess capacity requirements; partitions (despite the aws documentation) do not happen linearly, thus upstream partitions are necessary

misconfigurations.scenario: service autoscaling
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: implement autoscaling ECS
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: microservice architecture has a way to handle scaling of instances, but not scaling of containers; microservices are not scaling appropriately

misconfigurations.scenario: bin packing and consolidated instance types
instance types differ too much + CapacityReservationSpecification is set to open + reserved instance capacity underutilized
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: standardize ec2 instance type, platform, and Availability Zones

misconfigurations.scenario: lambda functions should not be used
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: https://www.serverless.com/aws-lambda#limitations
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: https://www.serverless.com/aws-lambda#limitations

misconfigurations.scenario: mutuple security groups for ssh access to ec2s
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: mutuple security groups for ssh access to ec2s
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create only ONE security group for the sole purpose of providing ssh access to ec2s

misconfigurations.scenario: pem key credentials stored on ec2 instance
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create a role that mimics desired user credentials
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: iam roles should be used to ssh into ec2 instances, aws user credentials should never be stored on ec2 instances

misconfigurations.scenario: Reserved instance recommendation
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Good for long predictable workloads

misconfigurations.scenario: Convertible Reserved instances recommended
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Good for long but variable workloads

misconfigurations.scenario: Scheduled reserved instances recommended
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Good for predictable workloads (eg Thursday's from 4-6pm)

misconfigurations.scenario: Dedicated host recommended
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Good when compliance requirements must be met or you have existing, server-bound software licenses you would like to keep

misconfigurations.scenario: Spot fleet (spot + on demand) recommended
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Spot fleets deployed with specific spot fleet strategy (lowestPrice, diversified, capacity optimized)

misconfigurations.scenario: Need more ec2 network performance, but don't care about reliability (eg big data workload)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Placement group, type cluster

misconfigurations.scenario: Don't care about network performance, but need to maximize reliability of compute on small to medium workloads
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Placement group, type spread

misconfigurations.scenario: Don't care about network performance, but need to maximize reliability of compute on large workloads (HDFS, Kafka, Hbase)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Placement group, type partition

misconfigurations.scenario: ??? EC2 failing and web address not valid?
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Create ENI and assignment logic for ec2 failover prevention

misconfigurations.scenario: Max IOPs hit (<32,000)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Increase EBS volume performance grade

misconfigurations.scenario: Max IOPs Hit (=32,000)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Use ec2 nitro for improved max EBS IOPs

misconfigurations.scenario: Licensing costs charge by the core + CPU is underutilized
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Decrease ec2 core count
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Helpful if you have high ram and low number of cpu

misconfigurations.scenario: Helpful to increase HPC workloads
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Disable ec2 multi threading

misconfigurations.scenario: Slow EC2 boot time
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Create AMI

misconfigurations.scenario: Clustered Linux powered application needs higher availability (eg Teradata)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: EBS multi-attach (io1/io2 volume family)
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Application must mange concurrent read and write operations

misconfigurations.scenario: Need up to 100k IOPS or more throughput on Linux or Windows machine
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable EBS RAID 0
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Good for high performance, High fault tolerance (or already enabled replication) applications

misconfigurations.scenario: User is unsure how to decide between EFS, EBS, or instance store
application / load balancers are not detecting failed connections fast enough
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: update response timeout, interval, unhealthy, and healthy thresholds for ELB(s) to a more ganular level
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: load balancer is not able to detect a failed response in a timely manner. this results in traffic being routed to an unhealthy resource

misconfigurations.scenario: client wants more detailed invoicing
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: generate a detailed cost and usage report
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: invoicing is grouped by high-level service type, region, and month. user would like to see an itemized report with specific user profile attached to the line item, in addition to custom grouping capabilities
misconfigurations.notes: not really a "recommendation" so much as a product feature, though it would likely be develped and stored in the same module (alerts_engine)

misconfigurations.scenario: maximum cpu utlization is greater than the alarm value and your application has auto scaling groups enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: alter desired capacity and maximum capacity to fit trending demand / workload requirements
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: You are running at desired capacity of 3 and the maximum capacity of 3. You have alarms set at 60% CPU to scale out your application. Your application is now running at 80% capacity.

misconfigurations.scenario: unhealthy, orphaned ec2 instances exist
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: setup both ASG and ALB and enable ALB health checks; ASG should be configured to terminate any unhealthy EC2 instances

misconfigurations.scenario: customer wants to auto-scale their instances based on the number of requests per minute (or some other metric)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create cloudwatch alarms and scale your instances based on the "better" metrics, like target average CPU usage, offered by cloudwatch (or some other custom metric)
misconfigurations.notes: custom metrics could come from other busines cases / systems, such as website traffic. cost / budget, etc.

misconfigurations.scenario: applications are exposed through an appication load balancer, and the load balancer is deployed on a VPC and the EC2s security on port 80 does not reference the ALBs security group
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: open up the ec2 security on port 80 to the ALBs security group

misconfigurations.scenario: Your application load balancer is hosting X target groups with various hostnames; you would like to expose https traffic for each of these host names.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: check if the client supports SNI (server name identification)

misconfigurations.scenario: default auto scaling cooldown is too long and unecessary costs are being incurred as a result
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: reduce costs by applying scaling-specific cool down and reducing the cooldown period
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: default cooldown period is 300 seconds; if a scale-in policy is used - that is, a policy that is used to terminate instances based on a specific criteria or metric - EC2 auto scaling needs less time to determine whether to terminate additional resources.

misconfigurations.scenario: reporting / analytics team wants to generate insights from your production relational database (e.g. RDS) but your production database is already taking on a normal load and you do not want to risk performance declines
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create a read replica to run the analyitcs workloads

misconfigurations.scenario: rds read replica has been created in another region
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: move the rds read replica to the same region as the rds db instance
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: cross region rds read replicas incur additional cost... business may have a reason for the setup, but it is likely a mistake

misconfigurations.scenario: parameter groups or database is not configured to ONLY allow SSL connection
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: comfigure parameter groups or db to only allow ssl connections

misconfigurations.scenario: high cpu / write frequency to aurora read replicas are causing performance issues, or you would like to specify custom endpoints for analytical queries
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create custom endpoints to query specific subsets of your aurora replicas
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: you know there are various sizes of aurora read replicas and you want to separate workloads by type

misconfigurations.scenario: infrequent, intermittent or unpredictable database workloads
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: recommend aurora serverless
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: automated database instantiation and autoscaling based on actual usage; pay per second; no capacity planning needed

misconfigurations.scenario: client wants ml predictins to your applications via sql
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: aurora machine learning with sagemaker or amazon comprehend

misconfigurations.scenario: client wants to build a gaming leaderboard that guarantees both uniqueness and element ordering;
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: elasticache - build redis with sorted sets
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: everytime a new element is added it is ranked in real time, then added to correct order

misconfigurations.scenario: rds struggles to keep up with demand of users on the website. users mostly read news / content and we (the company) do not post news / content often
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: scale reads with ElastiCache or RDS Read Replicas

misconfigurations.scenario: root volumes are not encrypted
end-user would like to group costs based on their business logic or product catalog
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create cost categories based on product catelog
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: in order to calculate true COGS, one must know what percentage of that cost infra is responsible for; in order to tie infra costs to product, you need to create cost categories
misconfigurations.notes: can be pseudo-automated, but requires business knowledge and human-to-human interaction; good candidate for consultancy hand-off

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to test a new app version with only a portion of the traffic sent
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create weighted routing policy

misconfigurations.scenario: HTTP/S & TCP endpoint health checks are not linked to cloudwatch
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: link endpoint health checks to cloudwatch
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: ~ 15 health checkers should be used, with a 30 second check interval; greater granularity possible with increased cost

misconfigurations.scenario: latency of applicaiton endpoints is not measured
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: route 53 endpoint healthchecks can detect request latency; this is valuable for companies who care about the performance of their web application

misconfigurations.scenario: As a solution architect managing a complex ERP software suite, you are orchestrating a migration to the AWS cloud. The software traditionally takes well over an hour to setup on a Linux machine, and you would like to make sure your application does leverage the ASG feature of auto scaling based on the demand.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Use golden images to incense provision resource time
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: User currently uses CloudFormation templates, AWS SDKs, or other IaC templates

misconfigurations.scenario: routing is currently set to a geolocation based policy, but does not have a default IP address
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create a default IP address to ensure all users who visit ythe specified IP have access to the content behind it

misconfigurations.scenario: user needs to increase the traffic to a specific region or AZ
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: increase geolocation routing policy bias of the region you would like to target / increase traffic on
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: e.g. user has a legal a requirement that people outside of France cannot access applicaiton content

misconfigurations.scenario: customer would like their users to get the least amount of latency when accessing thier application
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create a latency specific routing poilicy

misconfigurations.scenario: users are being routed to instances that are not running (or have performance issues)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable ELB health checks and ensure traffic is being routed only to instances that are stable / meet health check requirements

misconfigurations.scenario: user is experiencing poor performance on the website / application
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: scale reads using a write through architecture, leveraging elasticache (or dynamo) and RDS
misconfigurations.output_notes: less traffic on rds (decreases CPU usage) and improves performance in parallel; requires cache maintenance now, must be implemented on the application side (more costly)

misconfigurations.scenario: user is experiencing poor performance on the website / application
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: scale reads by increasing RDS read replicas (up to a maximum of 5)

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants multi az disaster recovery for their application
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: if users application leverages RDS and Elasticasche, ensure multi-az is enabled for both applications
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: this assumes the user is using RDS and/or elasticache to manage applicaiton state

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants a encryption with an audit trail
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: upload files with SSE-KMS (header "x-amz-server-side-encryption":"aws:kms"

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to supply their own encryption keys
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: upload files with SSE-C; HTTPS required

misconfigurations.scenario:
user wants to: 
- allow only logged-in user to download a premium video on their s3 bucket
- alow an ever changing list of users to download files by generating urls dynamically
- allow temporarily a user to upload a file to a precise location in our bucket
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: generate presigned urls with SDK

misconfigurations.scenario: user states that they want to be able to recover deleted s3 objects immediately for a set time (15 days) athough it happens rarely. after the set time, and for up to a year, deleted objects should be recoverable within 48 hours.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable s3 versioning and transition "non-current" versions to s3IA; afterwards noncurrent versions can be moved to DEEP_ARCHIVE

misconfigurations.scenario: s3 performance dips
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- request quota increase
- change your encryption type (from KMS to something else) 
- do a multipart upload
- enable s3 transfer acceleration
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: in most normal cases, quotas will exceed requirements, however in some scenarios, such as using KMS encryption in a limited region on high usage, you may be throttled

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to query s3 directly using simple, performant sql statements
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use s3 select
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: user should be able to filter by rows and colums, with less CPU cost client side

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to do analysis / query s3 with complex sql statements (or using a BI related tool)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use athena

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to prevent any other user (including themselvs) from overwriting data; user is likely requiring a WORM (write once read many) policy
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use glacier vault

misconfigurations.scenario: cloudfront distributions are too expensive
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: optimize routes, pricing table, and ingress (?) traffic to set proper cloudfront configurations based on path patterns (eg route images to foo and api requests to bar)

misconfigurations.scenario: NAT instances are used
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: convert to NAT gateway

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to distribute paid content from S3 securely and globally
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cloudfront singed url
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: assumes the S3 bucket is secured to only exchange data with CloudFront

misconfigurations.scenario: user is hosting highly dynamic content in Amazon S3 in [REGION_1]. Recently, there has been a need to make that data available with low latency in [REGION_2]
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: S3 CRR (cross region replication)

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to restrict users from accessing their content from a particular country
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cloudfront geo restriction

misconfigurations.scenario: You would like to provide your users access to hundreds of private files in your CloudFront distribution, which is fronting an HTTP web server behind an application load balancer
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cloudfront signed cookies

misconfigurations.scenario: You are creating an application that is going to expose an HTTP REST API. There is a need to provide request routing rules at the HTTP level. Due to security requirements, your application can only be exposed through the use of two static IPs.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use global accelerator and an application load balancer (Global Accelerator will provide us with the two static IP, and the ALB will provide use with the HTTP routing rules)

misconfigurations.scenario: User wants to migrateTB or PB scale data to aws, but has a slow network
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
use AWS SNOW family: 
- 0-8TB usable, snowcone
- 0-80TB usable, snowball
- <100PB snowmobile
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: common scenarios: data center migration / decommision, disater recovery, etc.

misconfigurations.scenario: uaer needs on premise file data backed up in the cloud
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use storage (file) gateway

misconfigurations.scenario: uaer needs on premise volume data backed up in the cloud
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use storage (volume) gateway
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: block storage using the iScsi protocol

misconfigurations.scenario: uaer needs on premise tape data backed up in the cloud
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use storage (tape) gateway

misconfigurations.scenario: user needs network file share system, but needs windows instances to access network files
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use FSx
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: (EFS for windows)

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to expose their s3 bucket as a file share system for linux devices
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use FSx Luster (linux + cluster)
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: satisfactory for HPC

misconfigurations.scenario: lambda function(s) has/have not been invoked in a long time
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: if lambda has not been invoked in [1 YEAR], recommend deletion
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: delete lambda
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: waste removal

misconfigurations.scenario: customer needs a database but is not sure which one to select or what to configure
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Heavy writes / simple queries = NoSQL
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use amazon dynamo db
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: read-heavy, write-heavy, or balanced workload? How many reads and writes are you going to need to per second? How will these values change if the numbers of users increases? How much data will you need to store? For how long? How quickly will this grow? Is there an upper limit in the near future? What are the sizes of each object? How will these objects be accessed? What are your requirements in terms of durability of data? Is this data store your source of truth? What are your latency requirements? How many concurrent users do you need to support? What is your data model and how are you going to query the data? Etc.

misconfigurations.scenario: customer needs a database but is not sure which one to select or what to configure
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Heavy reads / complex queries and joins = SQL
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use amaon RDS
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: (continuation from this)

misconfigurations.scenario: User wants to reduces duplicate messages in their queues
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: SQS is sending duplicate messages
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Increase visibility timeout

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to enable least privilege access across all accounts
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: using cloudwatch logs, determine if appropriate roles have been assigned to resources, roles, etc.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: reduce privileges where applicable

misconfigurations.scenario: processes that are controlled / run by lambda function are performing poorly
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: ram, cpu, or networking performance is not enough
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: increase ram
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: increasing ram of a lambda function also increases the cpu and network performance

misconfigurations.scenario: user has an IoT system (e.g. AWS edge) and wants to filter requests before they get to the application
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: deploy a CDN with cloudfront along side your lambda functions
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: i.e. use lambda to customize cdn content

misconfigurations.scenario: user has the "hot key" problem (too many reads) with dynamo
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use dynamodb accelerator (DAX)

misconfigurations.scenario: user cannot predict the capacity needed with dynamo (RCUs / WCUs)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: ProvisionedThroughputExceededException
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use on demand capacity (unlimited rcu & wcu)
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: on demand is 2.5x more expensive than provisioned capacity

misconfigurations.scenario: read latency is not performant for dynamodb tables OR user needs full replication (high reliability) of their dynamo tables
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use global tables feature in dynamo db; NOTE dynamo db streams must be enabled

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to restrict access to API from within VPC only
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use private api gateway
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: can use resource policies to define access

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to use api gateway with edge locations AND cares about performance
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use edge-optimized api gateway

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to know which OS are deployed to EC2 instances
user wants to restrict inline policies
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: InlinePolicies identified in S3 buckets
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Remove inline policies from the resource/bucket

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants encryption for s3 bucket write actions
user wants s3 bucket to utilize SSL
user wants s3 bucket encrypted at rest (SSE)
user does not want to grant any external privileges via ACL
user wants security groups to be defined under a VPC
user wants SSL/TLS certificate expiration alert 1 month in advance
user wants SSL/TLS certificate expiration alert 1 week in advance
user wants an encrypted connection between cloudfront and origin server
user wants encrypted storage for instances that might host a database
user wants to remove weak ciphers for ELB
user wants s3 bucket to have server access logging enabled
user wants s3 bucket to have versioning MFA delete enabled
user wants all instances configured under VPC
user wants to be notified if there has not been an inspector run in the last 30 days
user wants to prevent lambda functions with admin priviliges
user wants to ensure rotation for customer created CMKs is enabled
user wants to ensure s3 bucket access logging is enabled on the CloudTrail S3 bucket
user wants to ensure s3 buckets are not publically accessible
user wants to ensure amazon efs file systems are encrypted
user wants to ensure amazon efs file systems are encrypted using KMS CMK
user wants to ensure that lambda functions do not share the same AWS iam execution role
user wants to ensure that the defualt security group of every vpc restricts all traffic
user wants to ensure that s3 bucket used to store cloudtrail log is not publicly accessible
user wants to ensure virtual MFA is enabled for the 'root' account
user wants to ensure vpc flow logging is enabled in all applicable regions
user wants to ensure vpc flow logging is enabled in all vpcs
user wants to ensure iam policies are attached only to groups or roles
user wants to ensure iam policies that allow full "*:*" are not created
user wants to ensure that MFA is enabled for all IAM users with console password
user wants to ensure multi-region trail exists for each AWS CloudTrail
user wants to ensure no root account access key exists
user wants to ensure a support role has been created to manage incidients with AWS support
user wants to ensure appropriate subscribers to each SNS topic
user wants to ensure AWS config is enabled in all regions
user wants to ensure CloudTrail log file validation is enabled
user wants to ensure CLoudTrail logs are encrypted at rest using KMS CMKs
user wants to ensure CloudTrail trails are integrated with CloudWatch
user wants to ensure first access key is rotated every 90 days or less
user wants to ensure hardware MFA is enabled for the 'root' account
user wants to enforce password policy
user wants to be notified when a credentials report was generated in the last 24 hours
user wanst to be notified when there are any high level findings in inspector scan
user wants ecs cluster to be encrypted at rest
user wants to ensure that elb has a recommended ssl/tls protocol version
user wants to ensure ELB are created with access logs enabled
user wants to ensure ELB is setup with SSL for secure communication
user wants to be notified when ELB securied listener certificate expires in 1 month
user wants to be notified when ELB securied listener certificate expires in 1 week
user wants the use of 'root' account to be avoided
user wants AWS kinesis server data to have SSE at rest
user wants AWS kinesis streams to be encrypted with KMS CMK
user wants to rotate kinesis streams
user wants to be notified when ALB securied listener certificate expires in 1 month
user wants to be notified when ALB securied listener certificate expires in 1 week
user does not want to allow get actions from all principals
user does not want to allow list actions from all principals
user wants to know whether they should cache read content (in a serverless architecture) at the api gateway level or with a DAX caching layer (or other)

user has an applicaiton that is running on ec2 that distributes software updates "once and a while"; when a new software update is out the user gets a lot of requests and the content distibuted in mass ovecr the network is very costly; user does NOT want to change or re-architect the applicaiton
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: put cloudfront in front of the alb (and ec2 instances)
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: the addition of cloudfront does not require any changes to the existing infrastructures, allows the yuser to cach software update files at the edge (they are static, not dymic / changing files), cloudfront is serverless and will scale for the user, saving ASG & EC2 costs; i.e. cloudfront is a good way to scale and cheapen an application that serves / manages mostly static content

misconfigurations.scenario: users application has connectivity issues and cannot determine why
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: flow logs not enabled for vpc, subnets, or elastic network interfaces
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable flow logs for VPC, Subnet, and / or ENI

misconfigurations.scenario: user has a real time data feed from outside their vpc and is experiencing timeouts or slow download / response times
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use aws direct connect

misconfigurations.scenario:
1 - user wants to do streaming ETL, select columns, and make simple transformations
2 - user wants to generate metrics continuosly, like a live leaderboard game
3 - responsive analytics, look for a certain criteria and build alerting
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use kinesis data analytics

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to detect anomalous behavior in their data streams
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable RANDOM_CUT_FOREST in kinesis data analytics

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to detect dense areas in their data streams
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable HOTSPOTS in kinesis data analytics

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to stream videos, such as camera footage, or a producer sdk
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use kinesis video stream

misconfigurations.scenario: AWS resources lack cost allocation tags for tracking and attribution
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Resources exist without mandatory cost allocation tags (cost-center, project, owner, environment) preventing accurate chargeback and showback
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Implement organization-wide tagging schema with mandatory tags and use AWS Tag Editor or Tag Policies to enforce compliance
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: COST03-BP02: Without proper tagging, organizations cannot attribute costs to specific business units, projects, or applications. This prevents effective cost optimization, chargeback/showback, and financial accountability. Implement a consistent tagging schema including cost-center, project-id, owner, environment, and application tags. Use AWS Cost Categories to group costs, Tag Policies for governance, and Cost Explorer to analyze spending by tag dimensions.

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025

misconfigurations.scenario: No standardized decommissioning process resulting in abandoned resources accumulating costs
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: Resources exist for completed projects, no defined process for identifying and removing unused infrastructure, or resources without ownership tags
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Implement COST04-BP02 decommissioning workflow: verify usage, document metadata, apply restrictive controls temporarily, then systematically remove resources
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: COST04-BP02: Without a formal decommissioning process, organizations accumulate unused resources from completed projects, departed employees, or abandoned experiments. Implement a standardized workflow: 1) Identify resources for decommission, 2) Verify with stakeholders, 3) Document metadata (IPs, configs), 4) Create backups if needed, 5) Apply restrictive policies for observation period, 6) Remove from automation/monitoring, 7) Delete resources. Include load balancers, EC2 instances, Auto Scaling groups, EBS volumes/snapshots, Elastic IPs, AMIs, and Elastic Beanstalk environments.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS Well-Architected Framework COST04-BP02 - High risk if not implemented

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025

misconfigurations.scenario: AWS accounts lack budgets and proactive spending controls resulting in cost overruns
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: No AWS Budgets configured for monthly spend, service costs, or Reserved Instance/Savings Plan utilization tracking
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Create AWS Budgets for total monthly spend (with 50%, 80%, 100% thresholds), service-specific budgets, and RI/SP coverage tracking with SNS notifications
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: COST02-BP05: AWS Budgets provide proactive cost controls through customizable alerts and thresholds. Create budgets for: 1) Total monthly spend with 50%/80%/100% alerts, 2) Individual service costs (EC2, S3, RDS), 3) Specific projects/teams using cost allocation tags, 4) RI/SP utilization and coverage. First 2 budgets are free; $0.02/day per additional budget. Integrate with SNS for email/Slack notifications. Advanced: Use Budget Actions to automatically apply IAM policies or SCPs when thresholds exceeded. Organizations with budgets reduce cost overruns by 60-80%.
misconfigurations.notes: AWS Well-Architected Framework COST02-BP05 - Implement cost controls

metadata.source: AWS Well-Architected Framework Cost Optimization Pillar 2025

misconfigurations.scenario: EC2 instances are running on previous generations
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: EC2 instances are running on previous generations

misconfigurations.scenario: EBS volumes are running on previous generations
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: EBS volumes are running on previous generations

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to ensure instances are only on when needed (used during business hours, during a jobs runtime schedule, etc.)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria:
- tag(s) denote the instance as a "workday" instance and/or 
- the instance is only active for predictable times throughout the day
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use tags to specify active hours and create a lambda function to hibernate ec2 instance when outside of tagged hours
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: ec2s are only used during specified hours; usually during regular business hours or when attached to a job

misconfigurations.scenario: use wants to be made aware of any function throttling that ocurrs
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: function throttle counts are above threshold
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- place limits on how many concurrent "slices" (percentage of total concurrency available to your account / region) a single function can have
- request unreserved (5000) concurrency limit increases (no cost)
- configure a dlq to capture failure(s)

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to avoide lambda function throttling
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: concurrent executions in a period of time are predicted to exceed to concurrent execution limits (account limit -100)
misconfigurations.recommendation_action:
- place limits on how many concurrent "slices" (percentage of total concurrency available to your account / region) a single function can have
- request unreserved (5000) concurrency limit increases (no cost)
- configure a dlq to capture failure(s)

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to clean up unused or inactive lambda functions
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: if lambda function is older than threshold or does not have an invocation in the last n days
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: delete lambda

misconfigurations.scenario: user needs serverless (lambda) tracing functionality
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: user does not have x-ray tracing installed
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable x-ray

misconfigurations.scenario: RDS instances are running on previous generations
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: RDS instances are running on previous generations

rightsize RDS instances
user wants the rds storage to be encrypted
user wants to increase the performance of their ecs service(s)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: if max memory utilization is > 50% for more than 3 concecutive time periods AND autoscaling is not enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable autoscalling policy with target tracking; set target to 50%

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to make sure their services are all running the latest platform version
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: platform version != LATEST
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: update service in console to LATEST
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: this will cause the service to automatically rollback to the last stable state

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to associate user groups & roles to projects, teams, and other business units
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: check if resoruce has ANY tags, if no tags send recommendation
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use user-group association tagging solution

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to associate costs to cost centers, projects, teams, and other business units

misconfigurations.recommendation_action: use cost-center association tagging solution

misconfigurations.scenario: user needs to have an index of resources across regions they can search for
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: resource explorer is not enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable resource explorer

misconfigurations.scenario: user requires immutable resource tags
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: immutable aws tags have not been enabled
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable aws resource tags

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants fault tolerant internet access
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: instances exist in more azs than nat gateways exist
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: create nat gateway in each az where an ec2 instance exists

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to ensure CloudTrail is enabled in all regions
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: cloudtrail is not enabled in region X
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: enable cloudtrail

misconfigurations.scenario: Amazon Route 53 Alias Resource Record Sets
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: A resource record set is a CNAME to an Amazon S3 website.
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: Replace the listed CNAME resource record sets with alias resource record sets; You also need to change the record type from CNAME to A or AAAA, depending on the AWS resource
misconfigurations.recommendation_description_detailed: Checks for resource record sets that can be changed to alias resource record sets to improve performance and save money. An alias resource record set routes DNS queries to an AWS resource (for example, an Elastic Load Balancing load balancer or an Amazon S3 bucket) or to another Route 53 resource record set. When you use alias resource record sets, Route 53 routes your DNS queries to AWS resources free of charge. Hosted zones created by AWS services wont appear in your check results.

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to prevent volumes (root or attached) from filling up, forcing a restart and leading to a new IP address (if an elastic ip has not been assigned)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: volume storage capacity has less than threshold (%) remaining
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: increase the storage size of your targeted volumes

misconfigurations.scenario: user wants to get notified / know of non-compliant IAM keys (keys older than 90 days)
misconfigurations.alert_criteria: IAM key is older than 90 days
misconfigurations.recommendation_action: refresh IAM key
